description.narrative:
Public Service Development Agency (PSDA) under the Ministry of Justice of Georgia applied to Sweden for funding of 14,5 MSEK to carry out the project "Fostering Public Sector Development through Efficient Delivery of Urban and Rural Services" during the period 2014-2016.
The intervention aims improving services to public through enhancement of the agency´s operation capacity, introduction of innovations for better service delivery and fostering civic engagement at the local (municipal) level.
PSDA will implement the project itself and will manage the funds provided.

Public Service Development Agency (PSDA, myndigheten för utveckling av samhällsservice) under justitieministeriet i Georgien har ansökt till Sida om finansiering motsvarande 14,5 MSEK för att genomföra projektet ”Fostering Public Sector Development through Efficient Delivery of Urban and Rural Services” (Främja utveckling av den offentliga sektorn genom effektivt tillhandahållande av stads- och landsbygdsservice) under perioden 2015-2016.
Insatsen syftar till att förbättra servicen till allmänheten genom att utöka myndighetens operativa kapacitet, införa innovationer för bättre tillhandahållande av service och främja medborgerligt engagemang på lokal (kommunal) nivå.
PSDA kommer själv att genomföra projektet och förvalta de tillhandahållna medlen.

sector.narrative: Public sector policy and administrative management

description.narrative:
General question: Results related to the intended outcome 2017Question: Summarise results related to the intended outcome (this information will be sent to Open Aid)Answer: PSDA has revised and improved existing Case Management System (CMS), new guidelines were developed. As a result operational capacity of PSDA has strengthened.
PSDA has developed ID card software solution and now it is possible that citizens, holders of ID cards to reset PIN and PUK activation code in case of loss or theft. Prior to the Project the PIN code restoration was not possible that was one of the major obstacles for adoption of electronic signature and development of remote identification services in Georgia. On the top of it capabilities of Electronic ID cards have undergone considerable modifications and improvements.
In supporting the establishment of Electronic archive of civil acts that was among the requirements set as part of the EU-Georgia Visa Liberalisation Action Plan (VLAP) within the framework of the project more than half a million civil acts were digitalised.
PSDA surveyed which municipal services were most demanded by rural population, developed those services and launched those services in twenty pilot municipalities. In this context 136 municipality staff members from different municipalities were trained.
The project has worked on increasing civic participation and awareness regarding issues of gender equality, human rights of ethnic minorities and people with disabilities through conducting cultural, educational and informational Civic engagement events in different communities.
Overall it is assessed that the project delivered intended results and achieved planned outcomes.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
